definitions.definition: The state of being insusceptible to something; notably:
A resistance to a specific thing.
definitions.example: Superbugs are bacteria that develop an immunity to antibiotics.

synonyms: get out of jail free card

definitions.definition: Four shots of espresso.
A kind of round-robin tournament between four players, where each participant plays every other participant once.
The Bible, Book of Mormon, Doctrine and Covenants, and Pearl of Great Price bound in a single volume.
A poster, measuring forty by thirty inches, advertising a cinematic film release.
A quadrangle (courtyard).
A quadruplet (infant).
A quadrilateral.
The quadriceps muscle.
A quadriplegic person.
A quadrupel beer.
A quadcopter.
A quad bike (from quadricycle)
Abbreviation of quadrillion BTU. (1015 BTU)
A blank metal block used to fill short lines of type.
A joke used to fill long days of setting type.
(phototypesetting and digital typesetting) A keyboard command which aligns text with the left or right margin, or centred between them. In combination, as quad left, quad right or quad centre.
(exercise) quadriceps (thigh muscles)
Four of a kind
To do something that will be widely remembered for a long time.
definitions.example: Neil Armstrong made history in 1969 when he was the first person to walk on the Moon.

definitions.definition: Of a person, having achieved success by one's own efforts, with little to no support from family members and others.
definitions.example: My father was the quintessential self-made man.

definitions.definition: Of a thing, made by oneself instead of bought or taken over.
A bird of family Phasianidae, often hunted for food.
Any of several species of fish of the genus Thunnus in the family Scombridae.
The edible flesh of the tuna.
The prickly pear, a type of cactus native to Mexico in the genus Opuntia.
The fruit of the cactus.
A more or less square piece of material worn over the head, typically by women, often to protect the hair, or for religious reasons.
definitions.example: As far as only the Qur'an itself is concerned, wearing a headscarf is neither required nor prohibited.

definitions.definition: A person who is addicted, especially to a harmful drug
definitions.example: He is an addict when it comes to chocolate cookies.

definitions.definition: An adherent or fan (of something)
To deliver (someone or something) following a judicial decision.
To devote (oneself) to a given activity, occupation, thing etc.
To bind (a person or thing) to the service of something.

A seizure of someone's goods or possessions.
A state of mental distress, resulting in excited or erratic behavior (in the expression in a taking).
(in the plural) Cash or money received (by a shop or other business, for example).

definitions.definition: Possessing prominent and varied colors.
Interesting, multifaceted, energetic, distinctive.
Profane, obscene, offensive (usually in the phrase colourful language).
A gangster, gangsta.

Games (the statistic reporting the number of games that a player has participated in).
Green.

Grand (thousand dollars).

A photograph or video shared on this service.
A unit of gravitational acceleration.

A unit of mass equal to one-thousandth of a kilogram. Symbol: g
A leguminous plant grown for its seeds, especially the chickpea.
The seeds of these plants.
Grandmother
To recognize someone or something as different from others based on its characteristics.
To see someone or something clearly or distinctly.
To make oneself noticeably different or better from others through accomplishments.
definitions.example: The soldier distinguished himself in combat and received a medal.

definitions.definition: To make to differ.
Celebrated, well-known or eminent because of past achievements; prestigious
definitions.example: The lecture was attended by many distinguished mathematicians.

definitions.definition: Having a dignified appearance or demeanor
definitions.example: Her father was a distinguished gentleman, albeit a poor one.

definitions.definition: Specified, noted.
definitions.example: Let X be a topological space with a distinguished point p.

definitions.definition: One who rides racehorses competitively.
That part of a variable resistor or potentiometer that rides over the resistance wire
An operator of some machinery or apparatus.
A dealer in horses; a horse trader.
A cheat; one given to sharp practice in trade.
A prostitute's client.
A rapist.
To ride (a horse) in a race.
To jostle by riding against.
definitions.example: They were jockeying for position toward the end of the race.

definitions.definition: To maneuver (something) by skill for one's advantage.
To cheat or trick.
A posterior limb on an animal. When referring to quadrupeds, the term hind leg is often instead used.
A vehicle for collecting refuse.
An agent or drug that sedates, having a calming or soothing effect, or inducing sleep.
(pharmaceutical effect) Calming, soothing, inducing sleep, tranquilizing
A person who assumes an identity or quality other than their own.
definitions.example: He claims to be a doctor, but he's nothing but a fast-talking phony.

definitions.definition: A person who professes beliefs or opinions that they do not hold.
definitions.example: He's such a phony, he doesn't believe half of what he says.

definitions.definition: Anything fraudulent or fake.
Fraudulent; fake; having a misleading appearance.
definitions.example: A good jeweler should be able to tell a real stone from a phony one.

definitions.definition: After receiving a doctorate; especially of academic research or study beyond the level of a doctoral degree.
A stroke, in ball sports, in which the ball is hit immediately after it bounces off the ground
A delivery that bounces just short of the blockhole
Of excessive propriety; easily offended or shocked, especially by sexual matters
To apply pollen to (a stigma).
Pollinose.
A contributor to a vlog.
The state of being erotic, or of being sexually aroused
Sexual excitement, especially if abnormally persistent
Any set of machine-readable parallel bars or concentric circles, varying in width, spacing, or height, encoding information according to a symbology
A portion of a gene that identifies a particular species
Someone who has become free through escaping imprisonment.
Someone who has escaped.
A plant that has escaped from cultivation.
An electronic device which uses a piezoelectric transducer to make chirping noise, often designed to be hidden and function as an annoyance
Specifically, a version of the above designed to be thrown for placement. Similar to a throwie.
In a good mood; happy and energetic.

definitions.definition: Making chirping noises.
(of handwriting, print, etc) legible, possible to read or at least decipher
definitions.example: If that sign was still readable we'd know where we are!

definitions.definition: Which can be read—i.e. accessed or played—by a certain technical type of device
definitions.example: No sale, those aren't readable with my DVD-player!

definitions.definition: (of a book) enjoyable to read, of an acceptable stylistic quality or at least functionally composed
definitions.example: These assembly instructions aren't readable, I still don't have a clue how to start!

To relegate.
An event which may or may not happen; that which is unforeseen, undetermined, or dependent on something future.

A quota of troops.
Possible or liable, but not certain to occur.

definitions.definition: Dependent on something that may or may not occur.

definitions.definition: Not logically necessarily true or false.
Temporary.

The wing of a helicopter or similar aircraft.

Dimly lit, as at dusk (evening).

definitions.definition: Having a shade of color that is rather dark.
definitions.example: The dusky rose was of a muted color, not clashing with any of the other colors.

definitions.definition: Dark-skinned.
Ashen; having a greyish skin coloration.

Any of the days of a week on which work is done. The five workdays in many countries are usually Monday to Friday (and are defined as such in official and legal usage even though many people work on weekends).
definitions.example: It will take five workdays to process your application.

definitions.definition: That part of a day in which work is done.
definitions.example: My workday is 8 hours.

definitions.definition: A gradual healing after illness or injury.
The period of time spent healing.
One who willingly accepts being put to death for adhering openly to one's religious beliefs; notably, saints canonized after martyrdom.
definitions.example: Saint Stephen was the first Christian martyr.

definitions.definition: (by extension) One who sacrifices his or her life, station, or something of great personal value, for the sake of principle or to sustain a cause.
(with a prepositional phrase of cause) One who suffers greatly and/or constantly, even involuntarily.
definitions.example: Stan is a martyr to arthritis, Chris a martyr to Stan's endless moaning about it.

definitions.definition: To make someone into a martyr by putting him or her to death for adhering to, or acting in accordance with, some belief, especially religious; to sacrifice on account of faith or profession.
To persecute.
definitions.example: Some religious and other minorities were martyred until extinction.

definitions.definition: To torment; to torture.
definitions.example: The lovely Amoret, whose gentle heart

definitions.definition: The arts involving performance, such as dance, theatre, music, etc.
A message sent quickly, as a shipment, a prompt settlement of a business, or an important official message sent by a diplomat, or military officer.
The act of doing something quickly.
definitions.example: We must act with dispatch in this matter.

definitions.definition: A mission by an emergency response service, typically attend to an emergency in the field.
The passing on of a message for further processing, especially via a dispatch table.
A dismissal.
To send (a shipment) with promptness.
To send (a person) away hastily.
To send (an important official message) promptly, by means of a diplomat or military officer.

To rid; to free.

To hurry.
To deprive.

To make something inactive or no longer effective
To prevent the action of a biochemical agent (such as an enzyme)

The quality of being robust.
The chemical element (symbol Na) with an atomic number of 11 and atomic weight of 22.98977. It is a soft, waxy, silvery, reactive alkali metal that is never found unbound in nature.
An expression of an agent causing or forcing a patient to perform an action (or to be in a certain condition).

An inheritable estate in land held of a feudal lord on condition of the performing of certain services.
An estate of inheritance in land, either absolute and without limitation to any particular class of heirs (fee simple) or limited to a particular class of heirs (fee tail).
Property; owndom; estate.
Money paid or bestowed; payment; emolument.
A prize or reward. Only used in the set phrase "A finder's fee" in Modern English.
A monetary payment charged for professional services.
An additional payment given freely as thanks for service.
An acute febrile illness of tropical regions, caused by a flavivirus (Yellow fever virus) and spread by certain mosquitoes, characterised by jaundice, black vomit and the absence of urination.
(usually derogatory) A perceived sexual preference for ethnically East Asian women expressed by certain non-East Asian (especially Caucasian) men; racial fetishism towards East Asian women.
The male reproductive organ used for sexual intercourse that in the human male and some other mammals is also used for urination; the tubular portion of the male genitalia (excluding the scrotum).
definitions.example: The female clitoris is homologous to the male penis.

Formal social dancing in couples, popular as a recreation and also as a competitive activity. The ballroom dance repertoire includes dances developed from old European folk dances such as the waltz and minuet, Latin American dances such as the tango, rumba, and cha-cha, and dances of 20th-century origin such as the foxtrot and quickstep.

definitions.definition: In hope of success, using one's best guess

definitions.definition: A romantic partner for life. This can be same-sex or opposite-sex, married or without marriage, and monogamous or polyamorous.
